qas.question: What is the name of a location in Spectre which draws its inspiration from an Ian Fleming short story?
Who wrote the book Colonel Sun?
What short story inspired the name Hildebrand Rarities and Antiques?
"The Hildebrand Rarity"  is from what short story collection?
What is the name of the MI6 safehouse?
An MI66 safehouse is called what?
What is a reference to the long story "The Hildebrand Rarity"?

plausible_answers.text: his torture by the title character of Kingsley Amis' continuation novel Colonel Sun

qas.question: Blofeld's torture by Bond reflects what?
References to whose material can not be found anywhere in the film?

context: Further references to <b9_0>Fleming's<b9_0/> material can be found throughout the film; an MI6 safehouse is called "<a0_0><a5_0><b6_0><b7_0>Hildebrand Rarities and Antiques<b7_0/><b6_0/><a5_0/><a0_0/>", a reference to the short story "<a2_0>The Hildebrand Rarity<a2_0/>" from the <a3_0>For Your Eyes Only<a3_0/> short story collection.[citation needed] Bond's torture by <a4_0>Blofeld<a4_0/> mirrors <b8_0>his torture by the title character of <a1_0>Kingsley Amis<a1_0/>' continuation novel Colonel Sun<b8_0/>.[citation needed]
